newsitem.title: USA: Hurricane Isidore seen veering north.
newsitem.headline: Hurricane Isidore seen veering north.

text.p: Hurricane Isidore and its 105 mph (169 kph) winds churned through the open Atlantic on Friday and was expected to turn northwest by Saturday morning and remain over open seas, the National Hurricane Centre said.
At 11 a.m. EDT (1500 GMT), the centre of Isidore was about 1,160 miles (1,870 km) west of Africa's Cape Verde islands at latitude 14.5 north and longitude 41.7 west.
The storm's maximum sustained winds had risen to near 105 mph (165 kph), but little change in strength was expected during the next 24 hours, hurricane centre forecasters said.

Isidore was moving northwest near 15 mph (24 kph), which forecasters said likely was the beginning of a gradual turn toward the north that would keep the storm well away from any land, the forecasters said.
Isidore was the seventh hurricane to form this season in the Atlantic.
